CONCLUSION: Violation of P1-1;Violation of Art. 6-1;Pecuniary damage - financial award;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE , DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE .
CARDINAL . The applicants are the owners of a flat in GPE , which they had let to ORG
CARDINAL . In a writ served on the tenant on DATE , the applicants communicated their intention to terminate the lease and summoned the tenant to appear before the Rome Magistrate .
CARDINAL . By a decision of DATE , which was made enforceable on DATE , the Rome Magistrate upheld the validity of the notice to quit and ordered that the premises must be vacated by CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicants served notice on the tenant requiring her to vacate the premises .
CARDINAL . On DATE , they served notice on the tenant informing her that the order for possession would be enforced by a bailiff on DATE .
CARDINAL . Between DATE and DATE , the bailiff made CARDINAL attempts to recover possession .

CARDINAL . Each attempt proved unsuccessful as , under the statutory provisions providing for the suspension or the staggering of evictions , the applicants were not entitled to police assistance in enforcing the order for possession .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicants recovered possession of their flat .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law is described in the ORG ’s judgment in the case of ORG GPE [ ORG ] , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , ORG CARDINAL-V.
